CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6+6-3-d - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing) (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Article 6-3-d - Examination of witnesses)
JUDGES: Armen Harutyunyan;Kristina Pardalos;Ledi Bianku;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Pauliine Koskelo;Robert Spano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The present case concerns the applicant ’s trial and conviction for attempted murder of PERSON , a businessman and former parliamentarian . A co - defendant , PERSON , was tried and convicted for assisting an offender .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bomb placed under ORG car detonated when the latter started the engine in TIME . PERSON survived without major injuries .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG started an investigation into the matter . When questioned by police officers , PERSON pointed to the applicant ’s ex - husband , ORG , with whom he had major disagreements over business - related issues , as the only possible offender .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was summoned to the police station . Having acknowledged the existence of disagreements with PERSON , he denied the offence and stated that he had been at home with his son , PERSON , TIME before the incident .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder . The charges against him were eventually dropped DATE since his involvement in the offence had not been established .

CARDINAL . On DATE . , ORG ’s friend who also knew the applicant and the family , was interviewed . He stated , inter alia , that he was aware of ORG ’s problems with ORG and that the applicant had always been against ORG doing business with ORG since she considered the latter a “ scammer ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , ORG ’s neighbour , was interviewed and described his family as a normal and ordinary one . She mentioned that DATE before , the applicant had complained about PERSON because he owed them some money .

CARDINAL . On DATE GPE , the applicant ’s daughter , was interviewed and stated , inter alia , that she had learnt about her GPE divorce DATE previously . The parents had maintained good relations and the family was in contact almost every day . She also stated that , most of the time , the applicant stayed in the apartment where the father lived .

CARDINAL . On DATE A.B. , the applicant ’s neighbour , was interviewed . He stated that he had known the members of the family , ORG , the applicant and their CARDINAL children ORG and GPE , since DATE , when they had settled in the building .

CARDINAL . On DATE NORP , a friend of the family , was arrested following the discovery of a large quantity of firearms and explosives in his house . Shortly after , Y.W. confessed to ORG attempted murder and stated that he had acted on the applicant ’s orders .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and charged with instigation of attempted murder and property damage .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the investigation was concluded and the criminal case was referred to the PERSON and Nor - Nork District Court of GPE for trial . The bill of indictment included GPE in the witness call list while it appears that DATE . , PERSON and PERSON were not included in it .

CARDINAL . At the trial , ORG retracted his pre - trial statements , claiming that they had been obtained under duress . The applicant denied any involvement in ORG attempted murder , stating that she had divorced ORG in DATE and since then she had lived with their daughter GPE in another apartment while ORG lived with their son , PERSON She also stated that at some point she had been asked to sign some documents in relation to a contract between ORG and ORG since the contract concerned the sale of the house where she used to live , which she did . However , in general she had no connection with ORG and tried not to maintain any contact with him .

CARDINAL . At the hearing of DATE the applicant ’s lawyer asked for GPE to be excluded from the witness call list , since the latter was the applicant ’s daughter . This request was granted when GPE expressed her wish to use the testimonial privilege .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced her cumulatively to DATE imprisonment . ORG was also convicted . ORG found it established that the applicant had ordered ORG murder as the property - related disputes between the latter and ORG had also affected her property rights . In this connection the ORG mainly relied on the trial statements of ORG , GPE ’s spouse , and PERSON , his former colleague and the fact that the applicant was involved in court disputes with ORG , which showed that both she and ORG had a strained relationship with the latter .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the judgment of ORG . On DATE she lodged a supplement to her appeal claiming , inter alia , that she had no reason to murder PERSON as she had been living separately from ORG since their divorce in DATE and had no interest in his business activities .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings before ORG retracted his statements made before ORG and submitted that in reality he had organised the explosion of ORG car upon the applicant ’s request . However , he had no intention of killing PERSON , but was trying to frighten him . The applicant maintained her defence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE as regards her conviction and sentence , while ORG ’s sentence was reduced . In its judgment ORG , inter alia , established that although the applicant had divorced ORG , she had maintained a family - like relationship with him and expressed her annoyance at ORG actions in the presence of different people . In this respect , the judgment of ORG referred to GPE ’s pre - trial statement of DATE , DATE . ’s pre - trial statement of DATE , as well as the pre - trial statements of CARDINAL neighbours , PERSON and PERSON , made on DATE and DATE respectively .
